instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2828: What is 820-2828? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2828</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Display issue
threads.message: Got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2828</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with an external display issue. My customer replaced the GPU but couldn't get it to work. I got it and took it apart and reassembled it carefully and it started to work. I gave it back to the customer and they gave it back to their customer. It has been returned for not working. So far I can get an external image via TB but if I turn on with screen it will light up for a few seconds then goes black. The fourth diagnostic LED also turns off. Once it turn off I cannot get it to repeat the fault unless I leave it unplugged for a while. I assume since I get an image externally, the GPU is ok. Any ideas on what to check next? I think I tried to replace the LED driver board before but it didn't change anything.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2828</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Display issue
threads.message: I miss-spoke. I meant to say I have an INTERNAL display problem.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2828</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Display issue
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2828</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Display issue
threads.message: I did. Going to try new inverter board next

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2828</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Display issue
threads.message: So I put a new inverter board in and it seems to be working, though every once in a while the screen will go black for half a second then come back on. Trying to get password to check temps with HW Monitor

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2828</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Display issue
threads.message: Now I turned it off and the screen won't come back on.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2828</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Display issue
threads.message: When I power it back up that is...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2828</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Display issue
threads.message: So <SIGNAL>VIDEO_ON_L</SIGNAL> is 3.3V. Going to measure with LCD plugged in to see if it changes

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2828</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Display issue
threads.message: <SIGNAL>VIDEO_ON_L</SIGNAL> goes from 3.3v to .08v as LCD and 4th LED turns on turns on, then after 10 seconds screen goes off and it goes back high

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2828</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Display issue
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>VIDEO_ON</SIGNAL> comes from LCD panel.
<SIGNAL>DP_INTRNL_HPD</SIGNAL> goes off too?
You should try another display and flex.

Be sure <RESISTOR>R9050</RESISTOR>/51/10 have 0 ohm.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2828</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Display issue
threads.message: all three resistors measure o ohms, <SIGNAL>DP_INTRNL_HPD</SIGNAL> stays at 3.3V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2828</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Display issue
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>BL_FN</SIGNAL> must go high at same time with <SIGNAL>VIDEO_ON</SIGNAL>.
Check signals when the backlight problem is present.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2828</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Display issue
threads.message: Will check that, tried new LCD and cable to no avail. Thinking about replacing <CHIP>U9000</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2828</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Display issue
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2828</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Display issue
threads.message:
Remove <CAPACITOR>C9005</CAPACITOR> and try again.
You can even remove <CHIP>U9000</CHIP> and tie pads 1/4 together...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2828</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Display issue
threads.message: Didn't see your last post until now. I replaced the LB and still same issue. This narrows it down to three things that have not been replaced by me. The GPU , The Power supply and the actual wiring harness from the power supply to the rest of the computer. I do have the IR sensor unplugged. Would that affect anything?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2828</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Display issue
